messages.content:
Remove products of a specified model from your WooCommerce store and recall the corresponding products. The product must be taken off the shelf (set to draft or private status, or with catalog visibility set to hidden), rather than deleted. Given a product model, search for historical orders related to that product and send a recall email to the corresponding customer's email address. See `recall_email_template.md` for the email template. The email must include a Google Forms recall form created using the `recall_form_template.json` template, and return the form information in `recall_report.json`. The template is as follows:

```json
{
"form_id": "Google Forms form ID",

"form_url": "Google Forms form link",
}
```
{"type":"text","text":"Allowed directories:\n/workspace/dumps/workspace","annotations":null}
{"type":"text","text":"[FILE] recall_email_template.md\n[FILE] recall_form_template.json","annotations":null}

{"type":"text","text":"/workspace/dumps/workspace/recall_email_template.md:
# Product Recall Notice

## Urgent Notification

Dear **[Customer Name]**,

We have discovered a safety hazard with the product you purchased. In consideration of customer safety, we have decided to initiate a proactive recall of this product.

## Product Information

- **Product Model**: [Product Model]
- **Product ID**: [Product ID]
- **Your Order Number**: [Order Number]
- **Purchase Date**: [Purchase Date]

## Reason for Recall

This product may pose the following safety risks:
- [Specific risk description]
- To ensure your safety, please stop using it immediately

## Solutions

We offer the following options for handling the recall:

1. **Full Refund** – Refund the full amount at the original price
2. **Product Replacement** – Free replacement with a safe equivalent product
3. **Store Credit** – Convert to equivalent store credit, usable for future purchases

## How to Apply for Recall Processing

Please fill out the recall confirmation form: **[Google Forms Link]**

The form includes the following information:
- Customer basic information confirmation
- Product status description
- Choice of solution
- Any special requirements

## Important Reminders

- **Stop using** this product immediately
- **Keep the product packaging** for follow-up processing
- **After filling out the form**, we will contact you within 3 business days
- If the product has already caused damage, please keep the relevant evidence

## Contact Us

If you have any questions, please contact us immediately:

- **Customer Service Hotline**: 400-xxx-xxxx (24 hours)
- **Customer Service Email**: recall@company.com
- **Online Customer Service**: Visit our official website for live chat

## Apology Statement

We sincerely apologize for the inconvenience caused by this product quality issue. Customer safety and satisfaction are our top priorities, and we will continue to improve our product quality control processes.

Thank you for your understanding and cooperation!

---

**[Company Name]** Customer Service Team


---
/workspace/dumps/workspace/recall_form_template.json:
{
  "form_title": "Product Recall Information Confirmation Form",
  "form_description": "Thank you for cooperating with our product recall process. Please fill out the following information so we can assist you accordingly.",
  "fields": [
    {
      "name": "Customer Name",
      "type": "text",
      "required": true,
      "description": "Please enter your real name"
    },
    {
      "name": "Contact Email", 
      "type": "email",
      "required": true,
      "description": "Email address for further contact"
    },
    {
      "name": "Contact Phone Number",
      "type": "text",
      "required": false,
      "description": "Alternative contact number"
    },
    {
      "name": "Product Model",
      "type": "text", 
      "required": true,
      "description": "Please confirm the model of the product you purchased"
    },
    {
      "name": "Product ID",
      "type": "text",
      "required": true,
      "description": "Product identifier, can be found on the product packaging"
    },
    {
      "name": "Order Number",
      "type": "text",
      "required": true,
      "description": "Your purchase order number"
    },
    {
      "name": "Purchase Date",
      "type": "date",
      "required": true,
      "description": "The specific date of purchase"
    },
    {
      "name": "Current Product Status",
      "type": "choice",
      "required": false,
      "choices": ["Not Used", "In Normal Use", "Has Issues", "Discarded"],
      "description": "Please select the current status of the product"
    },
    {
      "name": "Return Preference",
      "type": "choice", 
      "required": false,
      "choices": ["Full Refund", "Product Replacement", "Store Credit"],
      "description": "Please select your preferred resolution option"
    },
    {
      "name": "Problem Description",
      "type": "paragraph",
      "required": false,
      "description": "Please describe in detail the issues you encountered with the product or any other relevant information"
    },
    {
      "name": "Agreement to Terms of Processing",
      "type": "checkbox",
      "required": true,
      "description": "I agree to proceed according to the recall processing procedure"
    }
  ],
  "settings": {
    "collect_email": true,
    "allow_response_editing": true,
    "limit_to_one_response": true,
    "show_progress_bar": true
  }
}

","annotations":null}

messages.content: {"type":"text","text":"Successfully wrote to /workspace/dumps/workspace/recall_report.json","annotations":null}

Here’s what I’ve done to execute the product recall:

1) Identified and removed the specified model from sale
- Target model: Smartphone Model X1
- Products affected:
  - Smartphone Model X1 - White Edition (ID: 10)
  - Smartphone Model X1 - Blue Edition (ID: 11)
- Action taken: Set both products to draft status and catalog visibility to hidden (not deleted). They are now off the shelf.

2) Created the Google Forms recall form from the provided template
- Form ID: 13awQKnds01HP5fvSTZ9zUjVB1yvAYmpUUsYzFJtuzDo
- Form URL: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/13awQKnds01HP5fvSTZ9zUjVB1yvAYmpUUsYzFJtuzDo/viewform
- The form fields follow recall_form_template.json (customer name, contact email, phone, product model, product ID, order number, purchase date, current product status, return preference, problem description, and agreement).

3) Saved the form information to recall_report.json
- File path: /workspace/dumps/workspace/recall_report.json
- Content:
  {
    "form_id": "13awQKnds01HP5fvSTZ9zUjVB1yvAYmpUUsYzFJtuzDo",
    "form_url": "https://docs.google.com/forms/d/13awQKnds01HP5fvSTZ9zUjVB1yvAYmpUUsYzFJtuzDo/viewform"
  }

4) Searched for historical orders and attempted to send recall emails
- I queried WooCommerce orders for both products (IDs 10 and 11) across all statuses. No matching orders were returned by the system.
- As a result, no recall emails were sent because there were no customer orders to notify.
- The recall email content is prepared based on recall_email_template.md and includes the Google Form link above, ready to send if orders become available.

Notes and next steps
- Despite product sales counters indicating past sales, the orders API returned no results. If orders exist in another system, archive, or date-limited environment, please ensure those orders are accessible to the WooCommerce API, and the process can automatically email impacted customers using the prepared template and form link.
- The two X1 products remain removed from public visibility and purchasing while this recall is in effect.
